requirements:
Basic To-Do List Website Requirements
User Interface:

Simple input field to add new tasks quickly.

List display area showing tasks clearly.

Checkboxes or toggles to mark tasks as completed.

Edit and delete options for existing tasks.

Responsive design for use on both desktop and mobile devices.

Task Management:

Ability to add, edit, and delete tasks.

Mark tasks as complete or incomplete.

Option to prioritize or categorize tasks.

Save tasks persistently (local storage or backend database).

User Experience:

Clear visual differentiation between completed and pending tasks.

Easy navigation and intuitive controls.

Option to reorder tasks by drag and drop or priority.

Technical Requirements:

Responsive front-end using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

Optional backend for user authentication and task storage (using database).

Cross-browser compatibility.

Performance optimized for fast load and smooth interactions.

state.requirements:
Basic To-Do List Website Requirements
User Interface:

Simple input field to add new tasks quickly.

List display area showing tasks clearly.

Checkboxes or toggles to mark tasks as completed.

Edit and delete options for existing tasks.

Responsive design for use on both desktop and mobile devices.

Task Management:

Ability to add, edit, and delete tasks.

Mark tasks as complete or incomplete.

Option to prioritize or categorize tasks.

Save tasks persistently (local storage or backend database).

User Experience:

Clear visual differentiation between completed and pending tasks.

Easy navigation and intuitive controls.

Option to reorder tasks by drag and drop or priority.

Technical Requirements:

Responsive front-end using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

Optional backend for user authentication and task storage (using database).

Cross-browser compatibility.

Performance optimized for fast load and smooth interactions.

functional_requirements.description: Users can add new tasks to their to-do list through a simple text input field.
acceptance_criteria: When a user types a task into the input field and presses 'Enter' or clicks an 'Add' button, the new task appears in the task list.
The input field is cleared after a task is added.

functional_requirements.description: Display all current tasks in a list format.
acceptance_criteria: All added tasks are displayed in a clear, scrollable list.
Each task in the list shows its description.
The visual state (completed or pending) of each task is clearly indicated.

functional_requirements.description: Users can mark a task as completed or reopen it.
acceptance_criteria: Each task has a checkbox or a similar control.
Clicking the checkbox toggles the task's status between 'completed' and 'pending'.
Completed tasks are visually distinct from pending tasks (e.g., strikethrough text, different color).

functional_requirements.description: Users can modify the description of an existing task.
acceptance_criteria: Users can click an 'edit' icon or double-click a task to make its text editable.
After editing, the user can save the changes, and the task list updates.

functional_requirements.description: Users can remove a task from their to-do list.
acceptance_criteria: Each task has a 'delete' button or icon.
Clicking the delete button permanently removes the task from the list after a confirmation.

functional_requirements.description: Tasks persist even after the browser is closed and reopened.
acceptance_criteria: Tasks are saved to the browser's LocalStorage when added, edited, deleted, or reordered.
When the user reloads or reopens the browser, their tasks are still present.

functional_requirements.description: Allow users to reorder tasks to reflect their priority.
acceptance_criteria: Users can drag and drop tasks to change their order in the list.
The new order is saved and persists after a page reload.

non_functional_requirements.description: The application must be responsive and work seamlessly on both desktop and mobile devices.
metrics: All functionality is accessible and usable on screen widths from 320px to 1920px.

non_functional_requirements.description: The application should load quickly and provide a smooth user experience.
metrics: Initial page load time under 2 seconds on a standard 3G connection.
UI updates (adding, deleting, editing tasks) should feel instantaneous (under 100ms).

non_functional_requirements.description: The application must function correctly on the latest versions of major web browsers.
metrics: Full functionality on the latest two versions of Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge.

non_functional_requirements.description: The application should be usable by people with disabilities.
metrics: Compliance with WCAG 2.1 Level A standards.
Semantic HTML and ARIA attributes are used where appropriate.

risks: Data Loss: Since data is stored in LocalStorage, users can accidentally clear their browser data, leading to the permanent loss of all tasks.
Scope Creep: Requests for features like user accounts, cloud sync, or task sharing would significantly increase complexity and require a backend, exceeding the initial timeline.
Browser Inconsistencies: Minor differences in CSS or JavaScript implementation across browsers may require specific fixes.
assumptions: The initial version will use browser LocalStorage for data persistence, eliminating the need for a backend database and user authentication.
The design will be minimalist and functional, focusing on core features rather than complex UI/UX elements.
User authentication and multi-user support are out of scope for this version.
The application is intended for personal use, so there are no collaboration or data-sharing features.
